Description: Vessel of pomegranate shape: the body of the vessel is opaque dark-blue glass, glossy surface, most of it covered by a register of feather pattern in opaque white, yellow, and turquoise-blue bordered at top and bottom by a yellow line. Surface convex; thin tan core. The rim is formed by a ring of six triangular fronds, one now missing and another slightly damaged, in the dark-blue body-material edged with yellow.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2009 May-present, Newcastle, Great North Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
